title: ICE scraps plans for N.H. detention center, Ayotte says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: ICE cancels plans for a detention center in Merrimack, N.H., following local pushback and discussions with Gov. Kelly Ayotte.
Gov. Ayotte conveyed local concerns to DHS Secretary Kristi Noem, leading to the cancellation of the Merrimack project.
The proposed detention center faced widespread opposition from local officials, residents, and some Republican lawmakers.

title: Cocaine levels in Nantucket’s wastewater are growing exponentially. No one is sure exactly why.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Cocaine levels in Nantucket's wastewater measured 100% above national averages in October and November 2025.
Police report recent major cocaine busts but do not frequently encounter cocaine in their daily operations.
Low benzoylecgonine levels suggest some cocaine may be disposed of, not consumed, contributing to wastewater spikes.

title: Readers across Massachusetts share photos from Mondayâ€™s blizzard
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Massachusetts communities received over 30 inches of snow from Monday's blizzard, with significant low visibility and strong winds reported.
Boston.com readers shared photos showing snow-covered sidewalks, streets with low visibility, and people and pets navigating the storm.
Images include sledders in Scituate, Harvard's BioLabs in snow, and snowy scenes in Cambridge and Somerville.

title: Massport: ‘there will be delays’ Tuesday at Logan Airport after the blizzard
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport faces delays and cancellations Tuesday due to blizzard effects; 454 flights canceled and 51 delays recorded at 10 a.m.
Nor'easter brought over 3 feet of snow to New England with Boston's wind speeds reaching 68 mph and 16.9 inches of snow at Logan.
Massport advises travelers to check flight status and allow extra travel time; airlines like JetBlue are waiving fees during the storm period.

title: First responders in Cohasset carry patient with snowblower injury to ambulance, which then got stuck
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cohasset first responders carried a snowblower injury victim during a blizzard to a waiting ambulance.
The ambulance got stuck in snow and required shoveling to continue, says Cohasset police.
Over 1,000 Cohasset residents lost power with roads blocked by fallen trees and wires, police report.

title: Review & setlist: Margo Price shows just enough country contrariness at Royale
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Margo Price performed at the Royale in Boston on February 22, showcasing her traditional country music style.
Price expressed her complex relationship with Nashville, while bringing a distinctive indie-country sound to her performance.
The setlist included original songs and covers by Waylon Jennings, Woody Guthrie, George Jones, and Bob Dylan.

title: Photo showing collapsed roof at Barking Crab amid blizzard was AI
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Barking Crab restaurant confirmed an AI-generated photo falsely showed their roof collapsed during a February 23 blizzard.
The AI photo circulated on social media and Reddit, but the restaurant posted evidence of an intact roof on Instagram.
The Barking Crab remained closed to clean up after the blizzard, which left two to three feet of snow in the region.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying the day after the historic blizzard
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston received 17.1 inches of snow, setting a new daily record for February 23, according to Boston 25 News.
T.F. Green International Airport in Warwick, RI reported 37.9 inches of snow, potentially a new state record pending verification.
Boston has surpassed 60 inches of snow this season, a level not reached since the 2015 winter snow blitz.

title: 4 maps predicting totals from Wednesday morning’s snowfall
author: John Waller
bullets: The National Weather Service predicts light snowfall Wednesday from a clipper system passing by north of the region.
Snow will develop after midnight Wednesday into mid-morning, likely mixing with rain at lower elevations.
Forecasts estimate snow accumulations of 1-3 inches for most areas, with slightly higher amounts in elevated regions.

title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Pine Street Inn outreach teams canvassed Boston during the blizzard, finding 50 people outside overnight in harsh conditions.
Boston shelters, operated by Pine Street Inn, accommodated over 660 people despite a capacity of 585 beds during the storm.
Shelters and warming centers will remain open 24/7 through Wednesday to provide refuge from the severe weather conditions.
